subject: Productivity
title: Groupthink
description: A quick, practical guide to Groupthink.

hook.text: President Kennedy's advisors all agreed the Bay of Pigs invasion would succeed. It was a disaster.

buildup.text: Irving Janis coined groupthink: when a group values consensus so much that critical thinking dies.

discovery.text: Symptoms include overconfidence, suppressed dissent, and illusions of unanimity.

twist.text: Smart people in groups make worse decisions than they would alone when conformity pressure is high.

climax.text: Assigning a devil's advocate or using anonymous input breaks the groupthink cycle.

punchline.text: Agreement feels good. It can also be dangerous.
